title: Leave Buster
body: Leave buster needs to be rethinked.  I've left 1 game in 3 months and i got 5 match 10 min low priority queue, Previously i left many games which i regret. The fact there is no reset on your profile even when you made the effort not to leave,  is quiet frankly shit and an unfair scheme in which players are not rewarded for making an effort to change.It is a blatant 'forget' about the player attitude taken by league. Also i notice when I play with my group of friends that  is when i get reported most. (BY THEM BECAUSE THEY THINK THEYRE FUNNY) HUEHUEHUE

replies.body: Well you could start by not spamming threads about the issue.
True but people will take you more seriously if you're not spamming them.
Who is them? You ? You need to click on the the thread to read it. Takes 2 seconds. Relax.
I've read both your threads about this particular issue and they're pretty much identical. Quite frankly the fact you've felt the need to post it twice makes me think you're just whining.
Not really. Its annoying when you make an effort not to be rewarded.
You're expecting to be rewarded for behaviour that's expected? Is that really the point of your multiple posts on the issue?

Bottom line, it's expected that you don't leave/DC enough games to be hit with an LPQ in the first place. If you do, then that can typically fall into a few categories (or a combination of them).

First, it may be because you consistently make the conscious decision to leave games, in which case you have no one to blame but yourself.

Second, it may be because your internet connection doesn't meet the minimum requirements, in which case it's up to you (as the players) to address that (for example, by contacting your ISP and addressing the issue with them) *or* accept the risk of LPQs (since you are still being a detriment to other players experience with the game).

Third, it may be because you experience issues with the client/game itself, and while Riot is *in part* responsible for that, it's still up to you (as the player) to recognise that you're having those issues and seek solutions, such as looking for work-arounds and/or fixes, contacting Support for help etc.

To be clear, LeaverBuster *does* give players a chance to get their account back into a neutral standing, however that occurs over *significant* periods of time, and consistent play. It doesn't happen overnight, because that would make higher tier punishments useless.

Leaverbuster has nothing to do with how you feel about leaving the game. Leaverbuster applies to games you have left, and have created a bad experience for the people on your team.

As for your friends, if they keep reporting you for no reason, I'm pretty sure they are flagged and their reports don't count by now, since they keep reporting the same person, for most likely the same reason.

Also, get better friends.
